text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Sakata was born in Ozu, Kumamoto on October 18, 1971. After graduating from Ozu High School, she joined for Nissan FC in 1990. However, the club was disbanded end of 1993 season. She moved to Prima Ham FC Kunoichi. She retired end of 1996 season. In 1999, she came back at Tasaki Perule FC and she played until 2002 season. In December 1989, when Sakata was 18 years old, she was selected the Japan national team for 1989 AFC Championship. At this competition, on December 24, she debuted against Nepal. She was a member of Japan for 1991 and 1995 World Cup. She also played at 1990 Asian Games, 1991, 1993 and 1995 AFC Championship. She played 10 games for Japan until 1996. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1989 1 0 1990 2 0 1991 3 0 1992 0 0 1993 1 0 1994 1 0 1995 1 0 1996 1 0 Total 10 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Kumamoto Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Nissan FC Ladies players Category:Iga FC Kunoichi Mie players Category:Tasaki Perule FC players Category:1991 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1995 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1989 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1991 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1993 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1995 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1990 Asian Games
title: Megumi Sakata
